Submodules¶

jaxl.learning_utils module¶

jaxl.learning_utils.get_learner(learner_config: SimpleNamespace, model_config: SimpleNamespace, optimizer_config: SimpleNamespace) → Learner¶

Gets a learner.

Parameters:

  • learner_config (SimpleNamespace) – the learner configuration

  • model_config (SimpleNamespace) – the model configuration

  • optimizer_config (SimpleNamespace) – the optimizer configuration

Returns:

a learner

Type:

Learner

jaxl.learning_utils.train(learner: Learner, config: SimpleNamespace, hyperparameter_str: str, save_path: str | None = None)¶

Executes the training loop.

Parameters:

  • learner (Learner) – the learner

  • config (SimpleNamespace) – the experiment configuration

  • hyperparameter_str (str) – the hyperparameter setting in string format

  • save_path (str: (Default value = None)) – the directory to save the experiment progress

jaxl.plot_utils module¶

jaxl.plot_utils.get_config(agent_path, env_seed=None, ref_agent_path=None)¶
jaxl.plot_utils.get_evaluation_components(agent_path, env_seed=None, ref_agent_path=None)¶
jaxl.plot_utils.icl_image_grid(context_inputs, context_outputs, queries, labels, preds, doc_width_pt=500.0, filename=None)¶
jaxl.plot_utils.plot_to_image(fig)¶

Convert a Matplotlib figure to a PIL Image and return it

jaxl.plot_utils.set_size(width_pt, fraction=1, subplots=(1, 1), use_golden_ratio=True)¶

Reference: https://jwalton.info/Matplotlib-latex-PGF/ Set figure dimensions to sit nicely in our document.

Parameters:

  • width_pt (float) – Document width in points

  • fraction (float, optional) – Fraction of the width which you wish the figure to occupy

  • subplots (array-like, optional) – The number of rows and columns of subplots.

Returns:

fig_dim – Dimensions of figure in inches

Return type:

tuple

jaxl.transforms module¶

class jaxl.transforms.DefaultPILToImageTransform(scale: float = 255.0)¶

Bases: object

A transform that converts PIL to a tensor scaled between 0 to 1. Assumes that the PIL images are in range [0, 255].

class jaxl.transforms.GaussianNoise(mean: float = 0.0, std: float = 1.0)¶

Bases: object

A transform that adds Gaussian noise to each feature

class jaxl.transforms.StandardImageTransform¶

Bases: object

A transform that converts uint8 to float tensor. Assumes that the images are in range [0, 255].

class jaxl.transforms.Transpose(axes: Sequence[int])¶

Bases: object

A transform that transposes a tensor

  • **kwargs –

class jaxl.utils.RunningMeanStd(epsilon: float = 0.0001, shape: Sequence[int] = (), a_min: float = -5.0, a_max: float = 5.0)¶

Bases: object

This keeps track of the running mean and standard deviation. Modified from Baseline. Assumes shape to be (number of inputs, input_shape).

get_state() → Dict[str, Any]¶

Returns the state of the running statistics.

Returns:

the running statistics state

Return type:

Dict[str, Any]

mean: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number¶

The running mean

normalize(x: Array | ndarray | bool_ | number) → Array | ndarray | bool_ | number¶

Normalizes the data using running statistics.

Parameters:

x (chex.Array) – the data

Returns:

the normalized data

Return type:

chex.Array

set_state(state: Dict[str, Any])¶

Sets the state of the running statistics.

Parameters:
